intro: Paepalanthus magalhaesii, commonly known as the Magalhães' cactus, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its compact, spiny structure. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to poor soil conditions. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
